definition: to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world

sentences.english: I must go down to the seas again, to the vagrant Gypsy life.
sentences.chinese: 我必须重回大海的怀抱，回到浪迹天涯的无拘生活。

sentences.english: His library displayed miscellanea of mementos from different parts of the world, a lifetime of traveling.
sentences.chinese: 他书房里满是浪迹天涯时，搜罗来的世界各地纪念品。

sentences.english: Shi led a wandering life for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 很长一段时间石涛都在过着浪迹天涯的生活。

sentences.english: I must wander again all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 我必须再一次浪迹天涯。

sentences.english: And lonely travelers wandering free, Will find their way back home with me.
sentences.chinese: 还有那浪迹天涯的游子，我会指引他找到回家的路。

sentences.english: End of the World traces a pot of rover Ruhou hard, you go after the wine warm memories of lean thinking.
sentences.chinese: 一壶飘泊浪迹天涯难入喉，你走之后酒暖回忆思念瘦。

sentences.english: In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 当时，浪迹天涯的吟游歌手到处受欢迎。

sentences.english: He took the midnight train goin' anywhere…
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他乘上了午夜的列车，浪迹天涯。

sentences.english: We compare with wave vestige the person of the limits of the earth, just having another a material of outer shell.
sentences.chinese: 我们和浪迹天涯的人相比，只是多了一个物质的外壳。

sentences.english: In your despair you wander about vainly seeking contentment in empty pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，你浪迹天涯，在虚无的快乐中寻找幸福。

sentences.english: She is gone forever. Who is going to be roaming this tiny planet with me for the rest of my life?
sentences.chinese: 她已经远去。我的余生里，谁将会陪伴我浪迹天涯呢？

sentences.english: Do not miss tasteless roaming alone took a gourd ladle thoughts of water.
sentences.chinese: 尽不知思念无味浪迹天涯独取一瓢思念黄河水。

sentences.english: She took the midnight train goin' anywhere…
sentences.chinese: 有一天，她乘上了午夜的列车，浪迹天涯。

definition: to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind
to roam about/to wander without a home
to go far/to escape to faraway places
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to have no cares/to be carefree
to be all alone in the world
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
to stay together/to rely on one another
lit. to rest and fly together (idiom)/fig. to live in each other's pockets/to be inseparable
